item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, September 8, 2024 at 9:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. An open discussion forum for ArXiv papers (43 points | 4 comments)
2. Asking the Wrong Questions (2017) (115 points | 53 comments)
3. Why OpenStack and Kata Containers are both seeing a resurgence of adoption (30 points | 3 comments)
4. Baiting the bot (56 points | 26 comments)
5. Minimal Web (33 points | 15 comments)
6. Gnome Files: A detailed UI examination (200 points | 89 comments)
7. WebP: The WebPage Compression Format (390 points | 142 comments)
8. Cracking an old ZIP file to help open source the ANC's "Vula" secret crypto code (184 points | 19 comments)
9. FutureRack: Server racks are everywhere. Now you can find them in your home (44 points | 21 comments)
10. Microui+fenster=Small GUI (76 points | 8 comments)
11. Pick Your Distributed Poison (85 points | 12 comments)
12. CitizenDJ – Make music using free audio and video from the Library of Congress (131 points | 7 comments)
13. A new rare high-rank elliptic curve, and an orchard of Diophantine equations (163 points | 11 comments)
14. Keyhole – Forge own Windows Store licenses (535 points | 248 comments)
15. Early science and stone engineering in Menga, a Neolithic dolmen (8 points | discuss)
16. Appalachian Trail Hiker Photo Archive (89 points | 19 comments)
17. Dogs can remember names of toys years after not seeing them, study shows (232 points | 114 comments)
18. How a 16th Century Explorer's Sailing Ship Works (4 points | discuss)
19. The "email is authentication" pattern (194 points | 273 comments)
20. GPT-fabricated scientific papers on Google Scholar (131 points | 76 comments)
21. Things to know about the Great Wave (219 points | 67 comments)
22. Battlestar Galactica: Technical Manual (2005) (21 points | 6 comments)
23. Groups underpin modern math (65 points | 31 comments)
24. WordPerfect for Unix Character Terminals (12 points | 1 comment)
25. Beyond Ctrl-C: The dark corners of Unix signal handling (82 points | 34 comments)
26. How to wrap a C compiler and preprocessor, really (44 points | 1 comment)
27. SQLToy (68 points | 11 comments)
28. The PERQ Computer (165 points | 91 comments)
29. Hallelujah, Leonard Cohen, and a Pulitzer Prize-winning writer's suicide (131 points | 77 comments)
30. Cruise ships chopped in half are a license to print money (4 points | discuss)
